result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard S. Ahler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**5 days credit, if revoked**
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard S. Ahler

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

(Case called at 9:43 AM - by Zoom) Prosecuting attorney DA Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard S. Ahler appeared by video, in custody from Green Bay Correctional.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad not in court. 
Defendant has attorney but has not had communication with the attorney. Defendant has not received the offer. State recites the offer. Defendant wants to take the offer and wants to dismiss his counsel. Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding right to an attorney. Defendant waives right to attorney. Court accepts Defendant's waiver of right to an attorney. Defendant waives right of personal appearance. 
9:47 AM- Attorney Hillestad appears in person- Defendant dismisses Attorney Hillestad. So ordered. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Defendant acknowledges prior convictions. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1- Battery by Prisoner as Repeater. Court accepts plea and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. Defendant makes a statement. 
Court withholds sentence and orders 24 months Probation with the following conditions: No acts or threats of violence towards anyone; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. 5 days credit, if revoked. Court orders 14 days for the Defendant to withdraw plea.

9:42 AM case called and held via Zoom. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Richard S. Ahler appeared by phone from Dodge Correctional, Attorney Roger M Hillestad appeared in court for Richard S. Ahler. Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 3-14-22 at 1:30 PM.
Hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
